intro: Clausena forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' klipfyn, is a small evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in coastal sandstone soils and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
